author: Jared Diamond
title: Which Baseball Fans Should Be the Angriest?
text:
Ah, spring training—the annual ritual of green grass and warm sunshine that serves as a reminder that the snow will eventually melt, the flowers will bloom and baseball will soon return. Or, in the case of 2018, an increasingly bitter labor battle between the owners and the players’ union caused by slowest-moving free-agent market in history.
Pitchers and catchers report to Florida and Arizona this week while dozens of their peers remain unsigned, including a handful of stars. So many players still need a job that the union... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
